libqt module¶

Commmon tasks for Qt widgets.

This module contains some common routines to simplify interaction with Qt libraries.

libqt.array2tab(tab, array, row0=0, col0=0, formatting='{}')¶

Write 2D array to QTableWidget.

Given a PyQt4.QtWidgets.QTableWidget and an iterable (or iterable of iterables), put the data from the array into the table.

Parameters:
  • tab (PyQt4.QtWidgets.QTableWidget) – The table to be written to
  • array (sequence of sequences) – The data to read from. The first level of the sequence will be interpreted as rows, and the second level as columns.
  • row0 (int) – index of first row to start writing data
  • col0 (int) – index of first column to start writing data

Note

this function does not resize the table in any way, it only writes into cells.

libqt.bool_crossed(items)¶

Say wheter items are crossed over or not.

Convert a stream of items into stream of bools where True means the item is crossed over and False if not.

Parameters:items (iterable) – must yield instances of PyQt4.QtWidgets.QTableWidgetItem to be filtered.
Yields:True for each item crossed over, False otherwise.
libqt.confirm_delete(parent, msg)¶

Pop up dialog to confirm option.

libqt.count_crossed(items, invert=False)¶

Count the items crossed over.

Parameters:
  • items (iterable) – must yield instances of PyQt4.QtWidgets.QTableWidgetItem to be counted.
  • invert (bool) – if True, count the items not crossed instead.
Returns:

The number of (not) crossed items
Return type:

int
libqt.create_combo(options, default_option=0)¶

Create QComboBox from options and default option.

Parameters:
  • options (sequence) – sequence of str with option for combo
  • default_option (int) – index of the defatult option
Returns:

PyQt4.QtWidgets.QComboBox
libqt.cross(items, to_cross=None)¶

Cross over the items provided.

Parameters:
  • items (iterable) – Provide a stream of PyQt4.QtWidgets.QTableWidgetItem objects which will be crossed or uncrossed over.
  • to_cross – If True, cross over the items; if False, uncross them over; if None, switch the value.
Raises:

TypeError – if any of the items is not PyQt4.QtWidgets.QTableWidgetItem
libqt.fill_column(tab, col, data, row0=0, flags=None, formatting='{}')¶

Fill column of a table with data.

Parameters:
  • table (PyQt4.QtWidgets.QTableWidget) – The table to write to.
  • col (int) – index of column to be filled with data
  • data (iterable) – data to fill column with
  • flags (dict) – extra flags to be passed to the newly created :class:`PyQt4.QtWidgets.QTableWidgetItem’ object
  • row0 (int, optional) – rows to skip at beginning
libqt.fill_column_comboindex(table, indices, comboitems, col, row0=0)¶

Fill a column with QComboBoxes.

Parameters:
  • table (PyQt4.QtWidgets.QTableWidget) – The table to write to.
  • indices (sequence of int) – The indices for the QComboBoxes to be initialized to corresponding to the item in comboitems.
  • comboitems (sequence of str) – The items to fill QComboBoxes.
  • col (int) – The index of the table column to loop over
  • row0 (int) – number of rows to skip at the beginning.
libqt.fill_row(table, row, data, col0=0, formatting='{}')¶

Fill row of a table with data.

Parameters:
  • table (PyQt4.QtWidgets.QTableWidget) – The table to write to.
  • row (int) – index of row to be filled with data
  • data (iterable) – data to fill row with
  • col0 (int, optional) – cols to skip at beginning
libqt.fill_row_comboindex(table, indices, comboitems, row, col0=0)¶

Fill a column with QComboBoxes.

Parameters:
  • table (PyQt4.QtWidgets.QTableWidget) – The table to write to.
  • indices (sequence of int) – The indices for the QComboBoxes to be initialized to corresponding to the item in comboitems.
  • comboitems (sequence of str) – The items to fill QComboBoxes.
  • col (int) – The index of the table column to loop over
  • row0 (int) – number of rows to skip at the beginning.
libqt.filter_crossed(items, invert=False)¶

Filter items in table crossed over.

Parameters:
  • items (iterable) – must yield instances of PyQt4.QtWidgets.QTableWidgetItem to be filtered.
  • invert (bool) – if True, yield the items not crossed instead.
Yields:

items in items for which the text is crossed over.
libqt.filter_tabwidget(table, ctype)¶

Filter widgets in a table of a specific type.

Parameters:
  • table (PyQt4.QtWidgets.QTableWidget) – The table to write to.
  • ctype (type) – The type to be filtered.
Yields:

The filtered objects.
libqt.indices_crossed(items)¶

List indices of items crossed over.

Parameters:items (iterable) – must yield instances of PyQt4.QtWidgets.QTableWidgetItem to be filtered.
Yields:indices items for which the text is not crossed over.
libqt.iter_column(table, col, row0=0)¶

Iterate over items in a column.

Parameters:
  • table (PyQt4.QtWidgets.QTableWidget) – A table to read from
  • col (int) – The index of the column to loop over.
  • row0 (int) – The row to start looping over.
Yields:

items in given column
libqt.iter_column_comboindex(table, col, row0=0)¶

Return indices of QComboBoxes in a column.

Loop over a column from row0 to the bottom, grab the PyQt4.QtWidgets.QComboBox and return the currentIndex value

Parameters:
  • table (PyQt4.QtWidgets.QTableWidget) – A table to read from
  • col (int) – The index of the column to loop over.
  • row0 (int) – The row to start looping over.
Yields:

int – the indices of the comboboxes along the column
Raises:

TypeError – if any cell on the way does not contain a QComboBox object.
libqt.iter_column_text(table, col, row0=0)¶

Iterate over items text in a column.

Parameters:
  • table (PyQt4.QtWidgets.QTableWidget) – A table to read from
  • col (int) – The index of the column to loop over.
  • row0 (int) – The row to start looping over.
Yields:

text from items in given column
libqt.iter_column_widget(table, col, row0=0)¶

Iterate over widgets in a column.

Parameters:
  • table (PyQt4.QtWidgets.QTableWidget) – A table to read from
  • col (int) – The index of the column to loop over.
  • row0 (int) – The row to start looping over.
Yields:

widgets in given column
libqt.iter_row(table, row, col0=0)¶

Iterate over widgets in a row.

Parameters:
  • tab (PyQt4.QtWidgets.QTableWidget) – The table to iterate over
  • row (int) – index of the row to iterate over
  • col0 (int, optional) – the initial column
Yields:

QTableWidgetItem – for each column read
libqt.iter_row_comboindex(table, row, col0=0)¶

Index QComboBoxes in a column.

Loop over a column from col0 to the end, grab the PyQt4.QtWidgets.QComboBox and return the currentIndex value

Parameters:
  • table (PyQt4.QtWidgets.QTableWidget) – A table to read from
  • row (int) – The index of the column to loop over.
  • col0 (int) – The row to start looping over.
Yields:

int – the indices of the comboboxes along the row
Raises:

TypeError – if any cell on the way does not contain a QComboBox object.
libqt.iter_row_text(table, row, col0=0)¶

Iterate over items text in a row.

Parameters:
  • table (PyQt4.QtWidgets.QTableWidget) – A table to read from
  • row (int) – The index of the row to loop over.
  • col0 (int) – The column to start looping over.
Yields:

text from items in given row
libqt.iter_row_widget(table, row, col0=0)¶

Iterate over widgets in a row.

Parameters:
  • table (PyQt4.QtWidgets.QTableWidget) – A table to read from
  • row (int) – The index of the row to loop over.
  • col0 (int) – The column to start looping over.
Yields:

widgets in given row
libqt.iter_tabwidget(tabwidget)¶

Iterate over the widgets of a QtWidgets.QTabWidget.

libqt.opendialog(parent, filters, directory='.')¶

Open file dialog and return filename selected.

Parameters:
  • filters (str) – filters in dialog
  • directory (str) – directory to open from.
Returns:

the file name selected
Return type:

str
libqt.popwarning(text, more_info)¶

Open messagebox dialog.

Parameters:
  • text (str) – title of the box
  • more_info (str) – additional information
libqt.remove_curr_row(tab)¶

Remove row currently selected.

libqt.replace_nones(table)¶
libqt.selected_rows(table)¶

Return a set with the rows currently selected in table.

libqt.tab2array(tab, rows, cols, dtype=<class 'float'>, masked=True)¶

Write 1D or 2D array to PyQt4.QtWidgets.QTableWidget.

Given a PyQt4.QtWidgets.QTableWidget and a range of rows and columns, the data in that area of the table is read and returned.

Parameters:
  • tab (PyQt4.QtWidgets.QTableWidget) – The table to read from
  • rows (iterable) – the rows to loop over and read
  • cols (iterable) – the columns to loop over and read
  • dtype (callable) – the type for the return array
  • masked (bool) – if set to True, values crossed over will not be returned. If False, all values will be returned.
Returns:

data to read from the table
Return type:

tuple of tuple
Raises:

IndexError – if any item in rows or cols is out of bounds.
libqt.tab2maarray(tab, rows, cols, dtype=<class 'float'>)¶

Write contents of table to a masked array.

Given a PyQt4.QtWidgets.QTableWidget and a range of rows and columns, the data in that area of the table is read and returned.

Parameters:
  • tab (PyQt4.QtWidgets.QTableWidget) – The table to read from
  • rows (iterable) – the rows to loop over and read
  • cols (iterable) – the columns to loop over and read
  • dtype (callable) – the type for the return array
Returns:

where the first element is the data read from the table and the

second is the mask.
Return type:

tuple
